alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 10:13AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Martin County through 1045 AM EDT... At 1011 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tequesta, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jupiter, Tequesta, Jupiter Island, Hobe Sound, and Hobe Sound Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
